ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of syntactic concepts needed to understand syntax literature and research, how to write syntactic analyses

The generative & minimalist approach to syntax.
A preliminary view of doing field work through the exercises embedded in the course material.
The importance of the mindset that for a science like linguistics, we need to let the theory fit the data instead of vice versa. That is, the ability to account for data of the theory is more important than its elegance.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the timings of the homeworks could be better and it would be nice to have feedback before completing subsequent homeworks. Additionally, I think it would be helpful to have smaller homeworks more often (as this would make it easier to remember the relevant concepts and apply them) rather than bigger and fewer problem sets.

Strength:
- very detailed walkthrough of the materials;
- a good combination of theories and exercises, which encourages more engagement.
- the instructor is very responsible and is available outside the class.

Weakness:
- (not sure if I will consider this a weakness): the pace of the course may not fit students with a variety of background.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, especially because of the lectures
YES! For both undergrads and grad students!
Yes, the course was helpful in understanding basic and deeper theories of syntax
